alert.note: Alert for Beckham; Custer; Dewey; Greer; Jackson; Kiowa; Washita (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 7:33PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Washita, northeastern Jackson, Custer, western Kiowa, southern Dewey, eastern Greer and east central Beckham Counties through 800 PM CDT... At 733 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles northwest of Custer City to 4 miles south of Dill City to 3 miles west of Warren. Movement was north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Clinton, Hobart, Mangum, Cordell, Granite, Burns Flat, Thomas, Sentinel, Blair, Arapaho, Dill City, Canute, Corn, Lone Wolf, Mountain Park, Custer City, Butler, Roosevelt, Gotebo, and Bessie. This includes Interstate 40 between mile markers 43 and 79. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Beckham; Custer; Dewey; Greer; Jackson; Kiowa; Washita
